channel.title: Login screen music
channel.description: was looking into adding an audio file to my client login screen. The source I am using is demonik, so if anyone has any idea how to do so, give us a buzz.

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @liquidazer liquidazer
item.description:
@liquidazer wrote:

Okay,

I found the java program called “jlGui”. Now is it possible to make this application run in the background when the client itself is opened? I would like to know how to program audio files into the actual game, but I dont really have enough time to do that at the moment so if this is possible then it would be great. Maybe if I use run.bat to open it as well as the client.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 10, 2009, 01:40:07 am[/size][hr]Okay Ive got the bat file working. “Quite simple”, The only problem is the music does not play automatically, I myself shall figure this out, and I thank you all again for your generosity.

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

KO9:

This thread: http://forums.sun.com/thread.jspa?threadID=5365717&tstart=0 should help you to play MP3 files using Java

Well, i kinda thought about this and since javax.media requires JMF(java media framework) doesn’t the user who want’s to play the music install JMF? That could be a big hassle…

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @liquidazer liquidazer
item.description:
@liquidazer wrote:

alrite cheers, thanks for the help

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“liquidazer, post:12, topic:261060”]Alrite thanks guys, Ill yell out if I get any probs.

cheers[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 09, 2009, 04:41:55 am[/size][hr]Okay I got the bit of code KO9 was refering too, but not too sure what it does, I aint overly huge at java, I can write extremely simple code so I dont know this sort of stuff. To make it a little more clearer what the question is… How do I get this code to play a certain MP3 file of my choice? Once this is done what do I name the file with the code in it? Then where should I put it in the client folder? Sorry for all these questions but my knowledge about java is quite limited, even the slightest amount of help is “GREATLY” appreciated, and thank you for your help so far guys. You’ve been awesome. [/quote]

We’re not going to spoon feed you. Giving you the methods to use is probably the most help someone is going to give you on this.

Try learning basic Java before attempting to modify the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @liquidazer liquidazer
item.description:
@liquidazer wrote:

Alrite thanks guys, Ill yell out if I get any probs.

cheers[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 09, 2009, 04:41:55 am[/size][hr]Okay I got the bit of code KO9 was refering too, but not too sure what it does, I aint overly huge at java, I can write extremely simple code so I dont know this sort of stuff. To make it a little more clearer what the question is… How do I get this code to play a certain MP3 file of my choice? Once this is done what do I name the file with the code in it? Then where should I put it in the client folder? Sorry for all these questions but my knowledge about java is quite limited, even the slightest amount of help is “GREATLY” appreciated, and thank you for your help so far guys. You’ve been awesome.

Read full topic

snoopy89:

http://www.fileinfo.net/extension/mem This maby right but not sure.

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

.mem is just an extension they slapped on. It’s not the type of audio format, and you would not wanna use the format they are using anyway, just install some type of MIDI audio reader.

Look into Java’s Open Audio Library (OpenAL) but even then your going to need some java knowledge to use it

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

the sound files inside the client (the animation sounds) are different format to anything you would expect playing music with. so scratch that.

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @liquidazer liquidazer
item.description:
@liquidazer wrote:

Once again it will play only once while you are on the “login screen”. During game play, players are able to listen to their own. (optionally)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 08, 2009, 10:31:06 pm[/size][hr]Maybe I can add a audio file using the sound system the game already uses. But making it play continually while the player plays the game. Since the system that the game uses has an option of being off or on, you cant go wrong. Anyone know which file to edit, to add a custom audio file into the system?

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @Jonesy1128 Jonesy1128
item.description:
@Jonesy1128 wrote:

Bad Idea. I listen to music whenever on PC and I hate having to pause it because of clashing sound files. I can guarantee you it would turn players away.

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @liquidazer liquidazer
item.description:
@liquidazer wrote:

Well the webclient sounds like a good idea but I dont want people to be able to control the music. All I want is the music to be automatically played in the background without a player poping up. (remember this is for the login screen only).

Read full topic

item.title: Login screen music
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

I suggest you use a webclient and under it set a media player/radio, that would be more easier for you.
